pull.title: peers-tab: cleaner presentation - more functionality
pull.body:
Initial Presentation:

![Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 6 27 28 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100163238-43526980-2e83-11eb-9a71-0628485d93cb.png)

peer table populated:

![Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 6 27 36 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100163269-536a4900-2e83-11eb-80da-34cf6c952374.png)

Detail View of selected peer:

![Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 6 27 50 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100163321-6a10a000-2e83-11eb-90d5-78d327d32fdf.png)

Window enlarged:
Peertable and detail view:
![Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 6 30 57 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100163372-87de0500-2e83-11eb-8d84-27afab6ffd07.png)


Additional Notes:

The widgets were renamed to offer a "self documenting" naming convention during the development.

![Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 6 39 18 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100163818-852fdf80-2e84-11eb-8c5f-5ec2fbc17e1f.png)

events.body: Concept ACK. You should split in multiple commits - renames, add more column(s), etc. Splitting in multiple commits also allows to split the PR so part  of it can be early merged. You also have unrelated changes, like in `RPCConsole::tabShortcut`, that should be removed.

rename.from: peers-tab: cleaner presentation - more info - functionality improvements

events.body: Autogenerated gui elements are necessary for VALID code.

peers-tab: cleaner presentation more functionality

events.body: I agree with @promag and @hebasto. Smaller, more-focused commits and PRs would be a good idea here. Make it easy for people to review and approve your changes (you're not alone, I struggle with this myself).

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
🐙 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

comments.body:
This is Qt Creator diff junk - I will correct this if/when ready for merge.
Thanks

This change allows the services string in the detail view to break.
The ampersands are extraneous (imo). 

![Screen Shot 2020-12-02 at 8 51 38 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100953280-4206e980-34e0-11eb-8182-6a835d71d226.png)

The "Bumper" will be used to add more columns to the peertablemodel.
The point of having abbreviated services flags is to conserve space so more information can be displayed in the table view. The underlying design principle is to display as much useful info as possible "at a glance" as well as allowing those columns to be sortable. Connection time and synced blocks will be added in a follow up PR. 

![Screen Shot 2020-12-02 at 9 03 14 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/100954065-dd4c8e80-34e1-11eb-9cdc-43262180bbd2.png)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -920,9 +920,30 @@
           <layout class="QVBoxLayout" name="verticalLayout_7">
            <item>
             <widget class="QTableView" name="peerWidget">
comments.body:
Upon further investigation I see that Qt Creator validates these types of files and generates these elements when Qt expects them. If they are not present when Qt expects them they generate an innocuous log - So they aren't unnecessary code - these elements are created by Qt when it expects them and is VALID code. I recommend stop considering these auto generated elements as "unnecessary code".

![Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 3 26 46 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152159/101084475-ff92ea80-357b-11eb-9ffe-590f6bd06feb.png)
